description: Continued use of single dwelling house as two self contained flats; use of single storey rear garden outbuilding as studio flat (Certificate of Lawfulness for an Existing Use)
decision_conditions: As required under Section 191 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended by section 10 of the Planning & Compensation Act 1991) sufficient evidence has not been submitted to show that the 2 self-contained flats within the main dwellinghouse and building described as Outhouse at 122 Woodlands Road has been used as a self-contained dwellinghouse for a period greater than 4 years. There is also an existing Enforcement Notice over the site and the development cannot be considered to be lawful as per s191(2)(b) of the Town and Country Planning Act. As such, it is therefore unlawful and the Certificate of Lawfulness is refused.
